molecular techniques: The scientific analysis of the fundamental building blocks of life, such as genes and DNA, to identify and understand the presence and characteristics of specific organisms or elements within a specific ecosystem or environment, thereby allowing for informed conservation and management strategies.

The application of modern biological methods that rely on the analysis of the building blocks of life, such as genetic components, to identify and classify specific organisms or components within an ecosystem, enabling a deeper understanding of complex relationships and interactions within the environment.

A scientific approach that relies on the analysis of minute biological components to identify and characterize organisms, revealing their relationships and presence, in order to better understand and conserve ecosystems.
